trans-unit.source: Activity 3: Run a JDBC program using the embedded driver

seg-source.mrk: Activity 3: Run a JDBC program using the embedded driver

target.mrk: Activity 3: Run a JDBC program using the embedded driver

trans-unit.source: This activity loads the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine using a simple Java JDBC program.

seg-source.mrk: This activity loads the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine using a simple Java JDBC program.

target.mrk: This activity loads the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine using a simple Java JDBC program.

trans-unit.source: WwdEmbedded.java program

seg-source.mrk: WwdEmbedded.java program

target.mrk: WwdEmbedded.java program

trans-unit.source: running

seg-source.mrk: running

target.mrk: running

trans-unit.source: CLASSPATH environment variable

seg-source.mrk: CLASSPATH environment variable

target.mrk: CLASSPATH environment variable

trans-unit.source: This activity assumes that you have opened a command window and navigated to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

seg-source.mrk: This activity assumes that you have opened a command window and navigated to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

target.mrk: This activity assumes that you have opened a command window and navigated to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

trans-unit.source: JDBC is the Java Database Connectivity API and is also the native API for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. The program uses the embedded driver to create the <codeph>jdbcDemoDB</codeph> database (if the database does not exist) and then connect to the database. You can then populate a table within the database with text. The program demonstrates some basic JDBC processing along with related error handling.

seg-source.mrk: JDBC is the Java Database Connectivity API and is also the native API for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
The program uses the embedded driver to create the <codeph>jdbcDemoDB</codeph> database (if the database does not exist) and then connect to the database.
You can then populate a table within the database with text.
The program demonstrates some basic JDBC processing along with related error handling.

target.mrk: JDBC is the Java Database Connectivity API and is also the native API for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
The program uses the embedded driver to create the <codeph>jdbcDemoDB</codeph> database (if the database does not exist) and then connect to the database.
You can then populate a table within the database with text.
The program demonstrates some basic JDBC processing along with related error handling.

trans-unit.source: The Java compiler and runtime use the classpath, specified by the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable, to locate the binary files (jar files and class files) that are needed to run <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and other Java applications. Before performing this activity, you need to set the classpath and compile the <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program.

seg-source.mrk: The Java compiler and runtime use the classpath, specified by the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable, to locate the binary files (jar files and class files) that are needed to run <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and other Java applications.
Before performing this activity, you need to set the classpath and compile the <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program.

target.mrk: The Java compiler and runtime use the classpath, specified by the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable, to locate the binary files (jar files and class files) that are needed to run <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and other Java applications.
Before performing this activity, you need to set the classpath and compile the <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program.

trans-unit.source: Copy the program files into the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory and set the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable, as shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to copy the program files into the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory and set the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to copy the program files into the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory and set the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to copy the program files into the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory and set the <codeph>CLASSPATH</codeph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: Operating System

seg-source.mrk: Operating System

target.mrk: Operating System

trans-unit.source: Command

seg-source.mrk: Command

target.mrk: Command

trans-unit.source: UNIX (Korn Shell)

seg-source.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

target.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

trans-unit.source: cp $DERBY_HOME/demo/programs/workingwithderby/* . export CLASSPATH=$DERBY_HOME/lib/derby.jar:.

seg-source.mrk: <b><userinput>cp $DERBY_HOME/demo/programs/workingwithderby/* .
export CLASSPATH=$DERBY_HOME/lib/derby.jar:.

target.mrk: <b><userinput>cp $DERBY_HOME/demo/programs/workingwithderby/* .
export CLASSPATH=$DERBY_HOME/lib/derby.jar:.

trans-unit.source: Windows

seg-source.mrk: Windows

target.mrk: Windows

trans-unit.source: copy %DERBY_HOME%\demo\programs\workingwithderby\* . set CLASSPATH=%DERBY_HOME%\lib\derby.jar;.

seg-source.mrk: <b><userinput>copy %DERBY_HOME%\demo\programs\workingwithderby\* .
set CLASSPATH=%DERBY_HOME%\lib\derby.jar;.

target.mrk: <b><userinput>copy %DERBY_HOME%\demo\programs\workingwithderby\* .
set CLASSPATH=%DERBY_HOME%\lib\derby.jar;.

trans-unit.source: Include the dot (<codeph>.</codeph>) at the end of each command so that your current working directory is included in the classpath and the files are copied to the correct location.

seg-source.mrk: Include the dot (<codeph>.</codeph>) at the end of each command so that your current working directory is included in the classpath and the files are copied to the correct location.

target.mrk: Include the dot (<codeph>.</codeph>) at the end of each command so that your current working directory is included in the classpath and the files are copied to the correct location.

trans-unit.source: Compile the program source files.

seg-source.mrk: Compile the program source files.

target.mrk: Compile the program source files.

trans-unit.source: The sample program is contained in two source files: <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.java</codeph>. Issue the following command to compile both at the same time:

seg-source.mrk: The sample program is contained in two source files: <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.java</codeph>.
Issue the following command to compile both at the same time:

target.mrk: The sample program is contained in two source files: <codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.java</codeph>.
Issue the following command to compile both at the same time:

trans-unit.source: javac WwdEmbedded.java WwdUtils.java

seg-source.mrk: javac WwdEmbedded.java WwdUtils.java

target.mrk: javac WwdEmbedded.java WwdUtils.java

trans-unit.source: A command prompt appears if the compilation is successful. The binary files <codeph>WwdEmbedded.class</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.class</codeph> are created. If an error message appears, verify that the JDK is properly installed.

seg-source.mrk: A command prompt appears if the compilation is successful.
The binary files <codeph>WwdEmbedded.class</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.class</codeph> are created.
If an error message appears, verify that the JDK is properly installed.

target.mrk: A command prompt appears if the compilation is successful.
The binary files <codeph>WwdEmbedded.class</codeph> and <codeph>WwdUtils.class</codeph> are created.
If an error message appears, verify that the JDK is properly installed.

trans-unit.source: Run the program.

seg-source.mrk: Run the program.

target.mrk: Run the program.

trans-unit.source: The <xref href="rwwdactivity3.dita#rwwdactivity3"><codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program</xref> populates a table with wish-list items. The program prompts you for text input (up to 32 characters), stores the text input in a database table, and then lists the items stored in the table. The program continues to ask for wish-list items until the you type the command <codeph>exit</codeph> or a problem is encountered. Some basic information on program progress is displayed at the beginning and the end of the program.

seg-source.mrk: The <xref href="rwwdactivity3.dita#rwwdactivity3"><codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program</xref> populates a table with wish-list items.
The program prompts you for text input (up to 32 characters), stores the text input in a database table, and then lists the items stored in the table.
The program continues to ask for wish-list items until the you type the command <codeph>exit</codeph> or a problem is encountered.
Some basic information on program progress is displayed at the beginning and the end of the program.

target.mrk: The <xref href="rwwdactivity3.dita#rwwdactivity3"><codeph>WwdEmbedded.java</codeph> program</xref> populates a table with wish-list items.
The program prompts you for text input (up to 32 characters), stores the text input in a database table, and then lists the items stored in the table.
The program continues to ask for wish-list items until the you type the command <codeph>exit</codeph> or a problem is encountered.
Some basic information on program progress is displayed at the beginning and the end of the program.

trans-unit.source: java WwdEmbedded org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDriver loaded. Connected to database jdbcDemoDB . . . . creating table WISH_LIST Enter wish-list item (enter exit to end): a peppermint stick __________________________________________________ On 2012-09-14 09:46:37.77 I wished for a peppermint stick __________________________________________________ Enter wish-list item (enter exit to end): a long vacation __________________________________________________ On 2012-09-14 09:46:37.77 I wished for a peppermint stick On 2012-09-14 09:46:51.654 I wished for a long vacation __________________________________________________ Enter wish-list item (enter exit to end): exit Closed connection Database shut down normally Getting Started With Derby JDBC program ending.
